issue.title: Python: basic PyList <-> Arrow marshaling code
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-31](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-31). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
To start, this will encompass only lists containing flat data (i.e. no list or dict members). For example:

```Java
[1, 2, None, 3, 4]
['foo', 'bar', None, 'baz']
[True, False, False, True, None]
```

Type inference on more complicated Python lists (as occurring from `json.loads`, for example) is something we can explore later (if it is deemed useful).

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-31?focusedCommentId=15183534) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
First draft of this (with nested lists, but no booleans – more work needed for bools in C++ core) available here https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/19

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-31?focusedCommentId=15183947) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 19
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/19>
